intro: Tournefortia auro-argentea, commonly known as silverleaf tournefortia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its silver-gray foliage, which is covered in fine, soft hairs. The plant produces showy yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the warmer months. Native to tropical and subtropical regions, it thrives in well-drained soil and full sunlight. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes.
